I'm a fan. They are a good fit & they go well with most of my casual clothes. I wear them to work & the gym.

I recently read about barefoot shoes, designed with wider toe boxes like actual feet. Since I suffer from a painful bunion on my right foot I really wanted to try the concept out without investing a huge amount of money at first. I happened to catch these during prime day and liked how simple the style is making them a good choice for casual wear or, as in my case, work.  I like the look of them in general though a coworker commented on my "grandma" shoes. But I found that they actually weren't as wide in the area I needed them to be as I had hoped. I actually found them to be more painful for my bunion than my usual Converse preferred shoe and that they rubbed the same area on the opposite foot to the point of making it sore. I did find them very comfortable for my heels, arches, and ankles. This is after 9-11 hour work days on ceramic tile flooring in a restaurant.  Overall, I don't love them and I probably wouldn't recommend them for those looking at them as a barefoot shoe option. But if you like the look they're well made and the simple style is good for an everyday goes-with-everything option.
Nothing

After an accident in 2014 fractured my pelvis I found it hard to find a comfortable pair of shoes. These not only fit my wide feet beautifully but, they are very flexible too! I use them every day, either at work or in my day to day life, and they are showing minimum wear and tear, even after four months! I love the fact that if my dogs get them too dirty I can rinse them off and set them out to dry, and I don't have to worry too much about them deteriorating like you would most other brands! They are a true minimalist shoe with flexibility,and stability, and they provide great value!
